gobblin.metadata.types

Class GlobalMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.metadata.types.GlobalMetadata

  • public class GlobalMetadata
extends Object
    Represents metadata for a pipeline. There are two 'levels' of metadata - one that is global to an entire dataset, and one that is applicable to each file present in a dataset.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GlobalMetadata()
      Create a new, empty, metadata descriptor.

    • Method Detail

      • markImmutable

        public void markImmutable()
        Mark the metadata as immutable. Once this flag is set all attempts to modify the object will fail with UnsupportedOperationException.

      • isImmutable

        public boolean isImmutable()

                               throws IOException
        Create a new GlobalMetadata object from its serialized representation.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the JSON string cannot be parsed.

      • addAll

        public void addAll(GlobalMetadata other)
        Merge another GlobalMetadata object into this one. All keys from 'other' will be placed into this object, replacing any already existing keys.
        Parameters:
        other - Metadata object to add

      • mergeWithDefaults

        public void mergeWithDefaults(GlobalMetadata defaults)
        Merge default settings into this object. Logic is very similar to addAll(), but Transfer-Encoding gets special treatment; the 'default' transfer-encoding settings are appended to any transfer-encoding already set (vs simply overwriting them).

      • toJsonUtf8

        public byte[] toJsonUtf8()
